author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court on Wednesday ordered statutory notice to the Editor and Publisher of Tamil daily Dinamani summoning them to appear before the court in four weeks following a contempt of court petition moved by an advocate.

The petitioner, S. Sathia Chandran, alleged that the daily published an editorial on July 13, 2013 in which it faulted the Madras High Court for ordering a second autopsy following doubts over the circumstances under which Dalit youth Ilavarasan was found dead near a railway track in Dharmapuri soon after his wife Divya separated from him.

Alleging that the editorial had cast aspersions on the judiciary, he had on July 15, 2013 appealed to the court seeking to punish the editor and publisher for committing contempt of court.

The court had advised the petitioner to seek the permission of the Advocate General to move the contempt proceeding as the complaint is of criminal nature.

On Wednesday, the petitioner moved the contempt proceedings with the approval of the Advocate General before the Division Bench of Justice R. Sudhakar and Justice P.N. Prakash.

The daily’s editorial faulted High Court for ordering second autopsy on Ilavarasan
title: HC notice to Tamil daily editor, publisher
